Tudi Al Pacino se podaja v svet televizijskih serij
05 Nov 2019, 08:58 by STA

Ameriški filmski in gledališki igralec Al Pacino je igral mafijce, morilce in celo satana, zdaj pa se je poglobil v borca proti nacizmu. Upodobil ga bo v TV seriji Hunters, ki jo pripravlja producent in oskarjev nagrajenec Jordan Peele. Odlomek iz serije, katere avtor je David Weil, je objavil ponudnik Amazon Prime Video.



Ameriški filmski in gledališki igralec Al Pacino je igral mafijce, morilce in celo satana, zdaj pa se je poglobil v borca proti nacizmu.  Foto: Arhiv PN

SEATTLE > "To ni umor. To je micva," pravi Al Pacino v kratki video najavi, ki daje slutiti, kaj je mogoče pričakovati. Po poročanju portalov, kot sta New York Post in Rolling Stone, bo serija, ki se je sprva imenovala The Hunt, vsebovala deset epizod, predvajati pa jo bodo začeli prihodnje leto.



Al Pacino bo odigral Meyerja Offermana, ki se poveže s somišljeniki, da bi "zrušili na stotine visokih nacističnih uradnikov", ki "živijo med nami in načrtujejo, da bodo v ZDA ustvarili četrti rajh", piše v opisu. Nastopili bodo tudi Jerrika Hinton, Josh Radnor, Kate Mulvany, Tiffany Boone, Greg Austin, Louis Ozawa Changchien, Carol Kane, Saul Rubinek, Dylan Baker in Lena Olin.
Za velikana filmske industrije zadnjih desetletij bo to po pisanju portala Rolling Stone prva redna vloga v televizijski seriji. Nazadnje je zaigral v dveh odmevnih letošnjih filmih: Bilo je nekoč v Hollywoodu Quentina Tarantina in The Irishman, ki je v režiji Martina Scorseseja pravkar prišel v ameriške kinematografe. Oba sta potencialna konkurenta za morebitne oskarje, ki jih bodo podelili februarja prihodnje leto.
text:
Al Pacino is also entering the world of television series
05 Nov 2019, 08:58 by STA

American film and theater actor Al Pacino used to play mobsters, murderers, and even satan, but now he has deepened his fight against Nazism. He will be portrayed in the Hunters TV series by producer and Academy Award-winner Jordan Peele. An excerpt from the series, authored by David Weil, was published by Amazon Prime Video.



American film and theater actor Al Pacino used to play mobsters, murderers, and even satan, but now he has deepened his fight against Nazism. Photo: PN Archive

SEATTLE> "This is not a murder. This is a mitzvah," Al Pacino says in a short video announcing what he can expect. According to portals such as the New York Post and Rolling Stone, the series, initially called The Hunt, will contain ten episodes and will be released next year.



Al Pacino will play Meyer Offerman, who connects with like-minded people to "overthrow hundreds of senior Nazi officials" who "live among us and plan to create a fourth Reich in the US," the caption reads. Also performing will be Jerrika Hinton, Josh Radnor, Kate Mulvany, Tiffany Boone, Greg Austin, Louis Ozawa Changchien, Carol Kane, Saul Rubinek, Dylan Baker and Lena Olin.
For the movie industry giant in recent decades, this will be the first regular role on a television series, according to Rolling Stone. Most recently, he starred in two high-profile films this year: Quentin Tarantino's Once Upon a Time in Hollywood, and The Irishman, which just directed Martin Scorsese, has just made its way into American cinemas. Both are potential competitors for any Oscars to be awarded in February next year.
